description: Smallest prime containing a leading sequence of n ascending numbers.
comments: The MAGMA Calculator (http://magma.maths.usyd.edu.au/calc/) verified each of the 100 terms in the table as prime. - _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Aug 24 2009Can this sequence be proved to be infinite, a sort of Dirichlet's Theorem in reverse? - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 23 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..100 (probable primes)
example: a(6) = 12345623 is the smallest prime beginning with the string 123456.
author: _Enoch Haga_, Jan 16 2000
